intro: Frantzia talamancensis, commonly known as the Talamancan frantzia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
